about.name: Toronto
about.info_text: Toronto is the capital of Ontario and Canada's largest city, known for its diverse culture, stunning skyline, and numerous attractions. It's a city that offers a blend of historic and modern experiences, with a thriving arts scene, multicultural neighborhoods, and a beautiful waterfront. Toronto is a hub for business, culture, and entertainment and welcomes visitors with open arms.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 2.8 million
Province: Ontario
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Language: English
Currency: Canadian dollar (CAD)
about.climate_text: Toronto experiences a continental climate with warm summers and cold winters. Summers are typically mild to warm, with temperatures around 20째C to 30째C (68째F to 86째F), while winters can be cold with temperatures often dropping below freezing, and snowfall is common.

attractions_card.title: CN Tower
attractions_card.description: The CN Tower is one of the world's tallest freestanding structures and offers breathtaking views of the city from its observation decks and glass floor.

attractions_card.title: Royal Ontario Museum (ROM)
attractions_card.description: The ROM is Canada's largest museum of art, culture, and natural history, featuring a diverse range of exhibits and collections.

attractions_card.title: Distillery District
attractions_card.description: The Distillery District is a historic area with cobblestone streets, art galleries, restaurants, and unique shops set in heritage buildings.

attractions_card.title: Toronto Islands
attractions_card.description: The Toronto Islands are a group of small islands in Lake Ontario, offering a peaceful escape from the city with parks, beaches, and recreational activities.

attractions_card.title: Art Gallery of Ontario (AGO)
attractions_card.description: AGO is one of the largest art museums in North America, featuring an impressive collection of artworks from various periods.

attractions_card.title: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
attractions_card.description: This popular aquarium showcases a variety of marine life and offers interactive exhibits, including a mesmerizing underwater tunnel.

attractions_card.title: St. Lawrence Market
attractions_card.description: St. Lawrence Market is a historic market with food vendors, artisanal products, and fresh produce, making it a food lover's paradise.

attractions_card.title: High Park
attractions_card.description: High Park is Toronto's largest public park, known for its lush green spaces, a zoo, and beautiful cherry blossoms in spring.

food_card.title: Poutine
food_card.description: Poutine is a Canadian classic, featuring french fries topped with cheese curds and smothered in gravy. A must-try comfort food.

food_card.title: Peameal Bacon Sandwich
food_card.description: This sandwich features peameal bacon (back bacon) on a bun, often with toppings like lettuce, tomato, and mustard.

food_card.title: Butter Tart
food_card.description: Butter tarts are a sweet treat made with a buttery, sugary filling in a flaky pastry shell, a beloved Canadian dessert.

food_card.title: Kensington Market Street Food
food_card.description: Kensington Market is known for its diverse street food scene, with international flavors and unique culinary experiences.

food_card.title: Toronto-style Pizza
food_card.description: Toronto-style pizza is often square or rectangular, with a thick and fluffy crust and a generous amount of toppings.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont Royal York
hotels_card.description: The Fairmont Royal York is a historic luxury hotel in the heart of Toronto, offering elegant accommodations and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton, Toronto
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton, Toronto is a five-star hotel known for its exceptional service and opulent rooms with city views.

hotels_card.title: Thompson Toronto
hotels_card.description: Thompson Toronto is a stylish and modern hotel in the trendy King West Village, offering a rooftop pool and bar with panoramic views.

hotels_card.title: Bond Place Hotel
hotels_card.description: Bond Place Hotel is a budget-friendly option in downtown Toronto, providing comfortable accommodations for travelers on a budget.

hotels_card.title: HI Toronto Hostel
hotels_card.description: HI Toronto Hostel is a great choice for budget travelers and backpackers, offering affordable dormitory-style rooms.

transport_card.title: Toronto Pearson International Airport
transport_card.description: Toronto Pearson International Airport (YYZ) is the primary airport serving the city and offers a wide range of domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Toronto Transit Commission (TTC)
transport_card.description: The TTC operates buses, streetcars, and subways, providing extensive public transportation within Toronto.

transport_card.title: GO Transit
transport_card.description: GO Transit offers commuter train and bus services, connecting Toronto to nearby cities and regions in Ontario.

transport_card.title: Bike Share Toronto
transport_card.description: Bike Share Toronto provides rental bicycles at various stations throughout the city, offering a convenient way to explore.
